data.title: cocostudios/CocoStudio.h Too many include problems
data.body:
I did a scene with Cocos Studio later I export it as **.csb** file, all right for now. The problem appear when I try to use the **.csb** file into the code, I am use the following code for import the scene.

``` c++
#include "editor-support/cocostudio/CocoStudio.h"

// put where you want add your cocos studio project
Node *rootNode = CSLoader::createNode( "Filepath to .csb file" );
this->addChild( rootNode );
```

...But when I try this on the terminal:

``` bash
cocos run -p linux
```

I see that in: **CocoStudio.h** not can include the **"cocostudio/CCActionFrame.h"** and all the others includes that have it the **cocostudio/** prefix, and this prevent the game to be compiled :rage: 
### Notes:
- I am on Ubuntu 14.04
- I am using cocos2d-x-3.6
- I am using c++ as language
- Sorry for my english :expressionless:
- This not work for me: #8163

data.title: Merge pr11866: FileUtilsWin32 correct use all unicode version winapi.
Refactor scroll view bar

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
Refactor scroll view and scroll bar
- Added methods to manipulate scroll bar's opacity
- Refined scroll event dispatching.
  - Previously, scroll events were dispatched BEFORE the container moved. It caused that event listener has no way to know how much scrolled and where the inner container is now. It is changed to be dispatched AFTER the container moved.
  - Added an event which informs the inner container is moved. It is dispatched whenever the inner container's position is changed even without scroll like jump or direct changing.

data.title: _recreateVBOEventListener in VertexBuffer & IndexBuffer
data.body: Both VertexBuffer & IndexBuffer have _recreateVBOEventListener to monitor the event "EVENT_RENDERER_RECREATED". "_recreateVBOEventListener" is supposed to be put into Director::getInstance()->getEventDispatcher(), so that when the event is fired, it will recreate VBO objects.  It is created in the constructors, destroyed in the destructor, and removed from the event dispatcher. But  I can't find the piece of code that it was put into the event dispatcher. A possible BUG?

data.title: fix multiple camera capture screen bug.
Automatically customize ContentSize for RichText.
data.body:
- Added four methods 
  void setAutoReSize(bool,bool = false)
  bool isAutoReSizeBothWidthAndHeight() const
  bool isAutoReSizeWidth()
  bool isAutoReSizeHeight()
  (Please help me will this some function change a name! thx!)
- Automatically adjust row height of ContextSize; automatically adjust row height and column width of a single row. 
- Satisfy developer’s needs. Automatically size adjustment is a convenient function for easily aligning text.
